meanings.sent1: After working in the garden all day, my hands started to cornify from all the digging.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the constant friction caused the skin on her feet to cornify.
meanings.sent3: I guess I've been typing too much, my fingertips are starting to cornify!
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to cornify after years of disappointment and betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The old leather book cover had cornified with age, becoming tough and rigid.

meanings.definition: To form a horny layer on the skin.
meanings.sent1: The blister on her foot started to cornify, protecting the sensitive skin underneath.
meanings.sent2: After spending hours in the sun, her shoulders began to cornify to shield against further damage.
meanings.sent3: The lotion promised to cornify her dry elbows, making them smooth and soft.
meanings.sent4: The callus on his palm seemed to cornify, creating a barrier against the rough work he did.
meanings.sent5: The protective scales on the dragon's skin cornified, making it nearly impenetrable.
